title: BBC sport coverage in disarray over Gary Lineker free speech row
description: BBC sport presenter Gary Lineker was suspended after criticising the British government's new asylum policy.

title: What are the implications of the Saudi-Iranian diplomatic deal?
description: China brokers agreement between two adversaries to restore diplomatic relations.

title: Yemen’s warring sides hold prisoner exchange talks in Geneva
description: The Yemen talks began a day after Iran and Saudi Arabia announced a deal to re-establish diplomatic ties.

title: In Ecuador, the US risks being on the wrong side of history
description: The Biden administration should stop extending blind support for Guillermo Lasso's corruption-ridden presidency.

title: First rains hit Mozambique as Cyclone Freddy nears
description: The cyclone, one of the strongest storms recorded in the southern hemisphere, previously hit Mozambique in February.

title: UK protest backs health staff as doctors prepare to strike
description: Tens of thousands of junior doctors are set to strike in England on Monday for three days amid pay dispute.

title: Wagner mercenary chief demands more ammunition for Bakhmut battle
description: Chief of Russian mercenary group says his forces are close to the centre of front-line city in eastern Ukraine.

title: More than 1,000 refugees brought ashore in Italy rescues
description: Italian coastguard says it is wrapping up a large rescue operation that began after three boats were spotted off Italy.

title: Sorrow and shock in Germany after Jehovah’s Witness hall shooting
description: Some want more gun restrictions after a man shot and killed seven people at a place of worship in Hamburg on Thursday.

title: What to expect after Iran, Saudi Arabia agree to restore ties
description: The deal could have wide-ranging consequences but building on it, analysts say, will prove the main challenge.

title: Indonesia’s Merapi volcano erupts, blankets villages in ash
description: At least eight villages near the volcano have been affected by volcanic ash.

title: Blast in northern Afghanistan kills at least one
description: The explosion happened in Mazar-i-Sharif, the capital of the Balkh province, during an award event for journalists.

title: Dominion: The lawsuit that’s shaking Fox News
description: Could an upcoming court case leave a mark on the Fox network? Plus, Taiwan’s political satirists - taking digs at China.

title: Indian police arrest three after man killed for possessing beef
description: Naseem Qureshi, 56, died earlier this week after being attacked by a mob on suspicion of carrying beef.

title: ‘Changing global order’: China’s hand in the Iran-Saudi deal
description: China brokering a deal between longtime Gulf rivals is 'a broader sign of a changing global order', analysts say.

title: Sheikh Hasina: Bangladesh’s defender or attacker of democracy?
description: The Bangladeshi prime minister on claims of repression of political opponents and the ongoing Rohingya refugee crisis.

title: Hong Kong court sentences 3 Tiananmen vigil organisers to jail
description: The organisers of a yearly vigil to mark China's brutal 1989 crackdown were sentenced to four and a half months in jail.

title: Can China’s economy outpace the US?
description: Xi Jinping accuses the US of blocking China's rise as the nation sets the lowest growth target in decades.

title: Three years later: Lives reshaped by COVID-19
description: Al Jazeera spoke to people from across the world on how the pandemic affected their and others' lives.

title: Wagner mercenaries boss reveals recruitment drive due to Bakhmut
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin says he opened recruitment centres in 42 Russian cities to replenish ranks due to losses in Bakhmut.

title: Three years later, what we know: How did COVID start?
description: Scientists lean towards a natural spillover from animals, but China's opacity means a lab leak can't be ruled out.

title: China’s parliament names Xi Jinping ally Li Qiang as new premier
description: New premier Li Qiang, 63, a confidant of Chinese leader Xi Jinping, faces the task of reviving China's flagging economy.

title: ‘Solidarity’ with Gary Lineker: Reaction as BBC removes presenter
description: Support pours in for former England captain Gary Lineker, removed by BBC over tweets on UK government's refugee policy.

title: Best picture spotlight: Which film will win big at 2023’s Oscars?
description: Ten nominees are vying for one of filmmaking's top honours — but what are their strengths and weaknesses? Find out.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 381
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 381st day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Football’s Gary Lineker booted by BBC over refugee policy tweets
description: Lineker was removed as presenter of BBC's Match of the Day show after criticising UK government's asylum-seeker policy.
